definition: not to be relied upon
example: These claims are dubious and not scientifically proven.

definition: have an intense feeling of loss or lack and longing for something
example: They yearned to go home.

definition: 1. fill (a text, history, etc.) with examples of something unpleasant 2. a number of young animals born to an animal at one time
example: 1. The book is littered with errors. 2. A feline litter usually consists of two to five kittens.

definition: a group of young birds all born at the same time
example: The blackbird flew back and forth to its brood.

definition: consider to be unworthy of one's consideration
example: The older musicians disdain the new, rock-influenced music.

definition: relating to the structure of populations
example: The demographic trend is towards an older population.

definition: a period of temporary economic decline during which trade and industrial activity are reduced
example: Many people lost their jobs during the recent recession.

definition: a period of economic difficulty or depression
example: The boom was followed by the present bust.

definition: a person who is given the power or authority to do something for someone else
example: Since I wouldn't be available to vote, I nominated him to act as my proxy.

definition: the complete set of genetic material of a human, animal, plant, or other living thing
example: However, genome duplication alone is insufficient to develop complex biochemical pathways or novel cell structures.

definition: imagine as a future possibility; visualize
example: She envisioned the admiring glances of guests seeing her home.

definition: save, rescue, or set someone or something free from
example: He delivered us from the nightmare of junk paper.

definition: able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities
example: He was versatile enough to play on either wing.

definition: to ask someone for money, information, or help
example: It is illegal for public officials to solicit gifts or money in exchange for favours.

definition: have or contain a lot of that thing
example: The newspaper has a reputation for being littered with spelling mistakes.

definition: to stop something from happening or someone from doing something
example: Our holiday plans were thwarted by the airline pilots' strike.

definition: leave (a personal estate or one's body) to a person or other beneficiary by a will
example: Picasso bequeathed most of his paintings and sculptures to Spain and France.

definition: excessively proud of oneself; vain
example: Without wishing to sound conceited, I am the best salesperson in the company.

definition: of or relating to punishment given by law
example: He had been in and out of penal institutions from the age of 16.

definition: to pretend
example: He isn't really upset—he's just shamming.

definition: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something
example: He would have to find work to augment his income.

definition: the act of saying that you approve of or support something or someone
example: The campaign hasn't received any political endorsements.

definition: to be in charge of a formal meeting, ceremony, or trial
example: Who would be the best person to preside at/over the public enquiry?

definition: When qualities, characteristics, or smells pervade a place or thing, they spread through it and are present in every part of it.
example: The film movie is a reflection of the violence that pervades our culture.

definition: to try very hard to persuade someone to do something
example: We would spend every meal time entreating the child to eat her vegetables.

definition: to persuade someone forcefully to do something that they are unwilling to do
example: The court heard that the six defendants had been coerced into making a confession.

definition: something formed by adding together several amounts or things
example: Arsenal lost the second game, but got through to the final on aggregate.

definition: cause (something) to become messily smeared by rubbing it
example: She dabbed her eyes, careful not to smudge her make-up.

definition: better than average or better than other people or things of the same type
example: For babies, breastfeeding is superior to bottle-feeding.

definition: to disagree strongly
example: I took issue with him over his interpretation of the instructions.

definition: income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature
example: Taxes provide most of the government's revenue.

definition: form a judgement or estimate of (a situation, mood, etc.)
example: She is unable to gauge his mood.

definition: spread or disperse (something, especially information) widely
example: The purpose of a university press is to disseminate knowledge by publishing books and journals.

definition: the state or condition of being superior to all others in authority, power, or status
example: By the end of the war, the prince had established total supremacy over all his rivals.

definition: discourage (someone) from doing something, typically by instilling doubt or fear of the consequences
example: Some potential buyers will be deterred by the price.

definition: become progressively worse
example: She was taken into hospital last week when her condition suddenly deteriorated.

definition: heavily loaded or weighed down
example: He always comes back from France laden with presents for everyone.

definition: evaluate or check (something) by comparison with a standard
example: We are benchmarking our performance against external criteria.

definition: all future generations of people
example: The victims' names are recorded for posterity.

definition: solemnly undertake to do something
example: They pledged to continue the campaign for funding.

definition: to act without any respect for someone or something
example: She accused the government of trampling on the needs and rights of the ordinary citizen.

definition: admit or agree that something is true or valid after first denying or resisting it
example: That principle now seems to have been conceded.
